results.title: Production control. Part II
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The three final steps in production control scheduling, despatching, and follow up demonstrates the use of the master schedule and of the shop schedule, and how despatching in both centralised and de-centralised forms.

results.title: Production control. Part I
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The systematic procedure by which management regulates production to meet fluctuating demand consists of four main steps; routing, scheduling, despatching, and follow-up. This film develops the firs step, fully showing the basic importance of routing in manufacture.

results.title: Product development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The film considered the following: (1) The role of research in improving materials processes and product; (2) the qualifications for acceptable product ideas such as production requirements in relation to existing facilities; (3) and aspects of product engineering.

results.title: Physical facilities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Describes the steps in organising physical facilities of a new enterprise: 1) location from the aspect of available facilities; 2) type of building suited to the enterprise; 3) the arrangement and position of the buildings; 4) plant layout from the aspect of type production.

results.title: Methods analysis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Methods analysis is used to reduce production costs by increasing the productivity of men and machines. The film demonstrates the basic approach and techniques of the methods analyst in studying the manufacturing cycle and indicates methods for gaining employee co-operation.

results.title: Materials control
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The job of getting the right material in proper amounts to the right place at the right time is described under three materials-control functions of management: (1) Procurement; (2) inventory control; and (3) control of handling and transportation of materials in the production process.

results.title: Internal organization
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
Illustrates the fundamental purposes of business organization and basic organizational procedures, such as delegation of authority, division of labour and assignment of responsibility. Shows the types of organization that can be adapted to the needs of any enterprise.

group_works.title: Bali: island of gods and demons
Sumatra: island of rice and rubber

results.title: Bali: island of magic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”.
Bali is one of the many Indonesian islands, but it differs from the other Muslim islands in that the people are mainly Hindu, with some Buddhists and an underlying interest in nature worship and even roots of ancient nature worship. Shows the daily life of the Balinese, which is governed by a voluntary village council, the farming and fishing, the market and the monkey dance. Narrated by Roger Climpson. No other credits available.

results.title: Sumatra: island of the Bataks
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Indonesia”
Daily life of the Batak people of Samesir Island in Lake Toba, Sumatra, a farming and fishing economy.
